description: It uses https://github.com/QuokkaStake/cosmos-validators-exporter and the built-in Prometheus agent. Check our Github https://github.com/htwtech/cosmos-monitoring for more info.

options.content:
Independence is in the code. Strength is in the consensus. Reliability is in our nodes.

This dashboard can help you run a Cosmos fork validator. Please check our GitHub . You are free to change this dashboard as you wish.

Best regards, Hightower team.

panels.description: System load over all CPU cores together
panels.title: Sys Load

panels.description:
Measures the percentage of blocks where the validator participated successfully without missing any proposals.
This metric offers a clear view of the validator’s reliability and effectiveness in the consensus process. A high percentage reflects consistent and dependable performance, while a lower rate may indicate issues such as network instability or resource constraints. Tracking this metric is essential for maintaining validator efficiency and ensuring the overall health of the network
panels.title: Validator Acive Rate

panels.description:
Monitors how frequently the node receives block proposals within a specified time interval.
This metric helps assess the node’s participation in the consensus process. A consistent rate suggests stable network conditions and proper synchronization, while drops may point to connectivity issues or lags in syncing. Sudden spikes could indicate abnormal or unexpected network activity. Regularly tracking this metric is important for ensuring efficient block propagation and maintaining consensus stability.
panels.title: Proposal Receive Rate

panels.description: The total rate of incoming P2P messages in bytes.
panels.title: P2P Bytes per Sec

panels.description: The average duration the node takes to process blocks over the past minute.
panels.title: Block Processing Time

panels.description: The rate of incoming P2P messages in bytes per second.
panels.title: P2P Message Receive Rate

panels.description: The number of votes received by the node since startup that reference earlier block heights and consensus rounds than the node's current state.
panels.title: Late Votes per 1min

panels.description: Indicates the count of active outbound connections the node uses to distribute transactions via the gossip protocol.
panels.title: Mempool Active Outbound Connections

panels.description: Number of validators who did not sign
panels.title: Missing Validators

panels.description: This dashboard tracks the block processing time bucket, showing the total number of blocks that exceeded all defined processing time thresholds
panels.title: Block Processing Time Distribution

panels.description: Transactions rate processed by the node across all blocks in the chain.
panels.title: Transactions Rate

panels.description: The time difference in seconds between the block proposal timestamp and the timestamp of the most recent prevote that reached quorum during the prevote step.
panels.title: Prevote Message Delay

panels.description: Number of transactions rechecked in the mempool
panels.title: Mempool Recheck Rate

panels.description: The data size of the block in bytes
panels.title: Block Size

panels.description:
The number of pending transactions currently in the mempool.
An increasing count may signal high network activity or delays in block production, while an empty mempool typically indicates low transaction volume.
panels.title: Uncommitted Txs

targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk
WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers
Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk

title: Cosmos Validator
